revised_title: Anatomical Study of the Lung Structure and Nervous Apparatus in the Newt
tldr: This study examines the minute structure of the newt's lung, focusing on its nervous apparatus. The lungs are simple sacs without septa, and the nervous system is composed of numerous nerve strands and cells. The author suggests that the non-striped muscle in the lung may be a representative of the muscular tissues found in the alimentary canal.
